thread.title: Florida freshman Deiondre Porter charged with assault involving gun
thread.title_full: Florida freshman Deiondre Porter charged with assault involving gun

author: azcentral.com
title: Florida freshman Deiondre Porter charged with assault involving gun
text:
GAINESVILLE, Fla. — Florida defensive back Deiondre Porter faces four felony charges and one misdemeanor after an argument with his pregnant girlfriend during which he is alleged to have held a handgun to her head and fired a handgun in her direction in late September.
He was arrested by Gainesville police on Wednesday morning and remained in the Alachua County jail early in the afternoon. Florida announced that Porter, a redshirt freshman who had contributed on special teams, is suspended indefinitely.
"He's no longer with the football team," coach Jim McElwain said Wednesday on the SEC football coaches teleconference. "He's suspended indefinitely for obviously a choice. It's his choice not to be with us. I'm sure you'll read about it soon enough. It's one of those things that we don't obviously condone. Like I said, it was his choice."
MORE SEC FOOTBALL: Spanning the SEC
Porter was arrested on a charge of aggravated assault, a second-degree felony. The state attorney's office has also charged him with two counts of aggravated assault with a deadly weapon without intent to kill, a third-degree felony, and firing a weapon into a dwelling, vehicle or building, a second-degree felony.
Porter was also charged with misdemeanor criminal mischief.
According to the Gainesville Police report, Porter began to argue with his girlfriend around 2:15 a.m. on Sept. 29 and accused the woman — who was at the time 10 weeks pregnant — of being involved with one of his teammates. The woman went to her bedroom to avoid the confrontation, but Porter followed her there and pointed a handgun at her head. The report said Porter and the woman have been in a dating relationship since 2013 and that Porter was aware of the pregnancy priot to the incident.
USA TODAY
Without Will Grier, Florida shows faith in Treon Harris
The woman made attempts to contact the teammate via text message and phone calls "to prove she had not been intimate with him," the report said, but could not reach him. Porter told the woman they would try again in the morning and went to sleep in her bedroom while she slept in the living room.
According to the report, Porter began yelling at the woman again at about 7:15 a.m. and was pacing in the living room. The woman was standing near the front door, the report states, when Porter fired a handgun in her direction, with the bullet striking a wall where she was leaning. He left soon after.
Gainesville Police found a bullet hole in the wall near the front door where the woman said she had been standing an a .45-caliber shell casing under a chair in the living room near where she said Porter had been standing.
On Sept. 30, Gainesville Police made contact with Porter. He was the passenger in a vehicle in which the driver was found to be in possession of a .45-caliber handgun.
Porter has not played in either of the Gators' past two games since the incident. No. 11 Florida (6-0, 3-0 SEC) plays at No. 5 LSU (5-0, 3-0) on Saturday.
